newsitem.title: UK: N.Irish Catholics demean Protestant accordionist.
newsitem.headline: N.Irish Catholics demean Protestant accordionist.

text.p: Rampaging Catholic youths bent on revenge in Northern Ireland's weekend violence forced a 17-year-old Protestant to parade around an Irish nationalist estate playing hymns on his accordion while they stoned him.

Northern Ireland's Ulster Television (UTV) interviewed the youth, his face blacked out for security reasons, as he recounted his ordeal on Sunday when Catholics protested against the routing of a Protestant march down a Catholic street.
He showed his tattered shirt covered in blood from the beating he took when a masked gang of five caught him in his car in a street in Newry, 40 miles (60 km) south of Belfast.
"They beat me. Then they made me drive over to the other side and continued to beat me. Then they took my car and drove off," said the youth.
They probably wanted to ride it around for a while before torching it as youths did all over the province at the weekend to draw in security forces and then throw petrol bombs at them.
According to police figures, more than 200 vehicles were hijacked in Newry over the weekend in an orgy of violence that included the looting of the town's biggest supermarket.
But the gang opened the boot first.
The accordion was the give-away. It is an instrument often used by Protestant bands which accompany parades such as the Orange Order march which sparked the weekend violence.
Then they found the uniform which definitely labelled him a member of a Protestant marching band.

"They came back and and took me to a nationalist estate and made we walk round the estate playing the accordion," the youth said. As they marched him there in front of the car, they clipped his heels with the front wheels from time to time.
All the while his fingers beat out gospel tunes and hymns including "Nearer my God to thee" while youths pelted him with bricks and stones.
The youth said he believed he was saved from further punishment because an army "spy in the sky" helicopter spotted the incident.
The youths fled. The accordion player needed stitches to a head wound.
His car has not been recovered.
